original: KULLBERG-MAYER, Olof Fredrik, Bruksägare, Katrineholm, f Åmål 24/11 73 av fabr.-äg Haldan Mayer och Sara Karlgren, gm Amy Kullberg. Byggn.ing 00, byggn.kontr h Gbgs stad 00—03, statskontr f kasernbyggn o led av kasernkomm 03—07, dir i Carl Fredrikssons Träförädl.AB i Katrineholm 07—16, dir o styr.-ordf i Kullberg & Co AB där 13—17, ägt Stöpafors bruk 17—24, ag Katrineholms Elverk samt jordegend Sandbäcken o Pålstorp, vkst dir i Byggn- & Fastigh AB Sandbäcken. Ordf i drätselk o byggn.nmdn 15—20 samt i Kullbergska Sjukhusets direkt, led av hdls-kamm :s arb.utsk mm. Medverk vid utg av Sörml.boken 18, utarb Katrineholms hist i boken Sv:s Städer 24, medarb i Nord Fam.-bok 24. RNO, RVO. °KULLENBERG, Johan Fredrik, Direktör, Skurup, f Hbg 1/3 62, gm Agnes Anselius. Prakt i fad järnaff i Skurup, övert denna 86 0 inneh den fortf. Deltog i bild av Sk Järn-handl.frn 06, Sv Järnhandl.frn 07, Sv Köpm.frb 07 samt Skand Ktén, ordf i Sk Köpm.frb t 36 samt i dess Förl.AB, deltog i start av Skånemässan 11 samt dess v. ordf. Styr.led 1 Malmö—Ystads Jvg, Skurups Hotell AB mfl. Led av kommunalflm, kommunalnmd, byggn-o tax.nmd samt kyrkoråd, kyrkovärd, v. styr.-ordf i Skurups bibi i fi år, styr.led i pens.-styr, Frn Svaneholms Slott o Fprnm.frn, styr.ordf i samrealsk, fd v. ordf i fhsk o skolråd. En av stift av Skurups Skyttefrn. RNO, RVO mfl hed.tkn.
translated:
KULLBERG-MAYER, Olof Fredrik, Business owner, Katrineholm, b. Åmål 24/11 1873, son of factory owner Haldan Mayer and Sara Karlgren, m. Amy Kullberg. Civil engineer 1900, building contracts in Gothenburg 1900-1903, state contracts for barracks construction and led by the barracks committee 1903-1907, director at Carl Fredrikssons Träförädl.AB in Katrineholm 1907-1916, director and chairman of the board at Kullberg & Co AB 1913-1917, owner of Stöpafors bruk 1917-1924, manager of Katrineholms Elverk and owner of the estates Sandbäcken and Pålstorp, managing director at Byggn- & Fastigh AB Sandbäcken. Chairman of the finance committee and building committee 1915-1920, as well as the Kullbergska Hospital board of directors, member of the Chamber of Commerce's working committee, etc. Contributed to the publication of the book "Sörml.boken" in 1918, worked on the history of Katrineholm in the book "Sv:s Städer" in 1924, contributed to the Nordic Family Book in 1924. RNO, RVO. 
°KULLENBERG, Johan Fredrik, Director, Skurup, b. Helsingborg 1/3 1862, m. Agnes Anselius. Worked in his father's iron business in Skurup, took over in 1886 and continues to run it. Participated in the establishment of Sk Järn-handl.frn in 1906, Sv Järnhandl.frn in 1907, Sv Köpm.frb in 1907 and Skand Ktén, chairman of Sk Köpm.frb since 1936 and of its Förl.AB, participated in the founding of Skånemässan in 1911 and served as its vice chairman. Board member of Malmö-Ystad Railway, Skurups Hotell AB, and others. Member of municipal film board, municipal board, building and tax committee, as well as church council, church trustee, vice chairman of Skurups library for five years, board member of the pension council, from Svaneholms Slott and Fprnm.frn, chairman of the board of samrealsk, former vice chairman of adult education school and school council. One of the founders of Skurups Skyttefrn. RNO, RVO, and other honors.

structured.name: Olof Fredrik Kullberg-Mayer
structured.biography: Olof Fredrik Kullberg-Mayer was born on November 24th, 1873 in Åmål, Sweden. He was the son of Haldan Mayer and Sara Karlgren. Olof was a civil engineer, graduating in 1900. He worked in various positions, including building contracts in Gothenburg from 1900 to 1903, state contracts for barracks construction from 1903 to 1907, and as a director at Carl Fredrikssons Träförädl.AB in Katrineholm from 1907 to 1916. He was also a director and chairman of the board at Kullberg & Co AB from 1913 to 1917, and owned Stöpafors bruk from 1917 to 1924. Olof also managed Katrineholms Elverk and owned the estates Sandbäcken and Pålstorp. He served as a managing director at Byggn- & Fastigh AB Sandbäcken and was actively involved in various organizations, including Kullbergska Sjukhuset, the Chamber of Commerce, and the Nordic Family Book. Olof's contributions to books on Sörmland and Katrineholm are widely recognized. He held several positions of authority and received national honors such as RNO and RVO. Olof was married to Amy Kullberg.

career.occupational_title: Director and chairman of the board
